bow: did anyone have really rough labor and as result hesitate to have other kids know my fiance wants at least one more after we get married and sort of do too but had very difficult back labor and quite frankly terrified to go through that again know we could adopt or have an elective section but not sure how feel about either one of those did anyone else have similar experience especially like to know if anyone had back labor with more than one kid had awful back labor thank god for the epidural and my sons heart rate kept dropping any time was flat on my back not fun delivered with both legs on one stirrup turns out the cord was completely around his neck never again no more kids for me our birth was pretty traumatic at the time and for few months after held on to how much had been taken from me had planned wonderful natural water birth and with decells at 2cm was transferred and ended up with csection was really angry and hurt that did even get to try going naturally its just what happened think that time mends all wounds and that you are afraid of this now but with all things there are good and bad so sorry your delivery did go as planned think my labor was pretty regular about 30 hours no drugs but to me that was enough my husband wants another kid but he did go through that deleted nothing went as planned for me long 26+ hour labor ended up being put under for csection it was traumatic but would do it 10000 times over again to be able to open my eyes and see my son my epidural did do crap it mainly just numbed my thighs and leg this is how feel would do it all over again for my daughter but not sure can do it again for another baby my first labor was awful and over years ago for the most part do remember the worst of it my husband does though and questions our sanity as we are having soon eta had pre and was induced really fast to get her out and me better had an awful first birth was able to do the natural route like had planned but was nearly transferred from the birthing center after 10 hours stuck in transition at cm my baby head was tilted and lodged in the pelvis and the midwife tried manually dilating my cervix oh my god different positions and he finally just realigned and he was born not 10 minutes later was nearly at the point of asking to be transferred to hospital for section it was 21 hour labor total and half that time the worst experience of my life oh an my water broke during the very first contraction so felt everything my second was dream was very worried about the delivery and we hired doula she was amazing the labor was around hours only intense for about and my water stayed intact until she was crowning was able to get to the birthing center just in time for them to fill the tub for water birth each birth is totally different had seriously considered adoption as an alternative because was so frightened of labor my advice is that it will very likely be much easier birth consider hiring doula http americanpregnancy org labornbirth havingadoula html they usually are very expensive and they are there specifically to help you and attend to your comfort and needs women used to be surrounded by other women during birth even if your partner is there with you every minute of the labor having another woman there who knows what you are going through can make all the difference she not there to replace your partner midwife or doctor my wife was dead set on having girls since she herself was young lass our first child required 38 hours of labor and then she had an eclamptic seizure and was hospitalized for days our second child resulted in an undiagnosed uti you re recently postpartum you re still bleeding of course you do feel well rest and drink fluids which resulted in acute kidney injury and nearly landed her on dialysis after that she said hell no to third and had the essure implants put in to sterilize herself have looked into doula and would seriously consider getting one wo admit it to my fiance but put more trust in him when coming up with birth plan than should have he an ped anesthesiologist who delivered some babies during his residency so did plan too much thought all would just be cool because he was there throughout the pregnancy to answer questions etc and he was doctor well all was not cool he was visibly nervous and emotional because was in so much pain which in turn made me very anxious and upset apparently when it your partner screaming and puking it little different fwiw he was still an awesome partner but it sounds like doula would still be good idea imo the best thing about doula is that they are not emotionally attached to you and can keep level head 25hrs of induced labor ended up having section that got infected not having another baby that awful mine was amazing and wish asked for it sooner pitocin kicked my ass way more than anticipated each birth is different my son was 17 hours with hours pushing ended up needing the vacuum to get him out my daughters birthday was hours and 10 minutes pushing ve known women who have had great first birth and horrible second birth it different every time if your considering not having baby because labor sucks and is hard then maybe there is an underlying issue do you really want another baby or do you feel pressured into it thank you as have learned at least it holds true for me big life events never go as planned there is lot of silver lining though and the rough bit had to go through to bring this person into existence is so minor compared to the impact he has already made in my life and that of everyone around me had bad amp 21 hours lots of pitocin no epidural double nucal cord abruption and almost 100 stitches but good doctor who swore to me that my second would be the polar opposite she made good on her promise and my second came out with minimal pain pink and crying in under hours the second is so much easier anyway *because* it the second that the odds of it going badly are greatly reduced my labor was going great until it all went wrong wo go into the gruesome details but will say that had to have an operation six months after the birth to correct some problems love my boy and would go through it all again to have him but the birth combined with the fact that my husband is not hands on dad has totally ruled out any more children for me four day induction for twins epidural did work correctly for part of it but actually say my pregnancy was worse was so miserable for the months still planning on having another one if possible once these two are out of diapers this is the second time have seen you today make comment like this is this all you do go around and make passive aggressive comments edit never mind just looked at your comment history thanks for making reddit little bit worse would you be able to determine closer to the birth eg the baby was in certain position what the chances of difficult labour were again since the baby position is one of the primary causes of back labour is it if so and elective section was possible that might be your best plan four months pregnant with my second and yes bit concerned about labour do know how long was in labour know my water broke around on sunday and stayed home until about because they tell you to check in if your water broke and no baby within 12 hours got sent home returned around never experienced contractions like you had full back labour and it never let up we were left alone in an admitting room for several hours with no one checking on us around six someone came to see if wanted an epidural hell yes and it was placed got bit of sleep the epi apparently halted my labour so they let it wear off to see if that would restart things it did around 11 we reacted the pushing stage pushed for little over two hours and was rewarded with severe 3rd degree tear nearly fourth and lb 10 oz baby so yeah no contractions no idea when active labour started because no one bothered to check on us for hours major tear it not as bad as some people here but still enough to make me wonder if crazy for going for number two the horrible first days of breastfeeding just compounded it both mine exploded from the womb like vaginal chest burster tearing things along the way and in one case beating the ambulance to my lounge floor while terrified and traumatised 18mo old looked on shell shock tearing and no painkillers except silly little counter paracetamol that was suppose to just tide me over while the dull pain was growing with that to be my destiny there no way in hell will have more would hope for reasonable medium length had 32 hour labor followed by an emergency section followed by an infection in the section incision that infection spread to my blood stream and spent days in the icu on harsh antibiotics that ended up having an allergic reaction to all while my husband was home with our day old son my incision had to be re opened and drained and did heal completely shut again for months had to clean and dress it twice day for about months at that point could no longer dress it but still had to clean it and keep it covered with gauze at all times my son is now 10 months old ve spent more of his life recovering from the amp than ve spent being back to normal so at this point have no intention of going through that again love him like crazy but could have died from that infection and do want to miss out on watching my son grow up in order to give him little brother or sister have you talked to your fiance about it tell him what you are feeling and make sure that he understands how terrifying the thought of having another baby is listen to his feelings on the subject my hubby would like another some day but knows how feel about it and that am not ready to agree to something like that right now we still talk about it occasionally and we try to be open about our feelings know he is disappointed with the idea that we might not have another child but he also understands and respects how feel about it try not to let the conversation turn into an argument about who is right instead just ask him to try to understand how you are feeling about it this is good practice for other big disagreements that come up in marriage your feelings might change as your baby gets older maybe they wo have you talked to your doctor about the likelihood of having back labor again he or she may be able to give you an idea of how your next would be if you choose to have another had back labor with my first and was scared to do it again for sure no back labor with the other two though and ll be honest the labor was easier still horrible do get me wrong but nothing compares to the pain of back labor imo had bad experience with labor wanted to go all natural if possible but my body would dilate even though my water broke the doctor only let me go hours after my water broke before discussing section my daughter was also going into distress with every contraction so had to have the section mentally it was the worse thing for me even though recovered quickly do know if want to go through those emotions again had very long difficult labor with my first 73 hours long prodromal labor back labor plus hated pregnancy though it was normal and healthy then baby girl was hugh needs and super colicky for months and said never do it all again somehow yrs later we decided to go for second baby riding on the idea that there is no way the second could be longer labor we lucked out at only 24 hrs of labor this time though thinking probably never again lol 30hrs of induced labor csection that got infected had another kid and currently trying for third seriously planned csection after an awful birth is the shit not exactly what you asked but ll say this had my first and only eight weeks ago today had planned sec at 39 weeks we chose that because so many people we knew had had horrible experiences and ended up with anyway which are more likely to be problematic after prolonged labour mine was awesome not single complaint and would choose the same again do discount this option if you want second child my first labor was horrendous days of early labor one day of hard labor with pitocin and no pain meds the pain was excruciating and it took long time for my body to recover have had four more children since then and each time was easier than the last my last three were all under hours of labor and the next day and was back to my usual self walking cleaning taking care of my other children oh and had back labor with all five of them the pain got much easier to deal with with each child hope this helps some as far as amp my first was great my second sucked because the epidural did have time to kick in nothing too crazy though my thing was pregnancy had horrible first pregnancy at months was seeing doctors times week bed rest and tremendous amounts of pain hated being prego and that made us off having another we looked into adoption bc was so dead set against going thru 10 months of hell again adoption did really seem to suit us so reconciled with the idea that just had to suffer thru it to get well my 2nd pregnancy was breeze totally different than the first even open to the idea of one more bc of how ez it was you just never know what it will be like it could be completely different the second time around good luck if you had traumatic labour there no shame in wanting to go through that again you could do scheduled section but even then there no guarantee that it wo be painful third though not labor itself but my entire first successful pregnancy was extremely difficult in and out of the hospital bleeding bed rest the list goes on had pretty smooth induction but my son was almost 10 lbs and destroyed my pelvic floor bled lot and almost needed transfusion it took weeks to be able to stand for more than couple minutes at time and had pretty severe ppd with bad reactions to the medications we tried to treat it with and my son is still very difficult and has higher needs second pregnancy was honestly breeze smooth delivery even though my epidural did work plus normal sized baby very minimal bleeding after slight hemorrhage after placenta delivery and was up and about the next day plus way easier baby wish could go back to my pregnant self and say if they give you high doses of pitocin get an epidural right away had great birth plan that helped even when needed section as had skin to skin with baby when they sewed me up and nursed within an hour had blind spot when it came to pitocin even though knew birth was wildcard the 27 hours of natural labor was intense but the hours of pitocin induced labor was unbearable deleted my water broke but my contractions long she was stuck had an epidural but something went wrong and went from starting off not being able to move my legs to being able to 100 support myself with no help the nursing staff and doctor seemed annoyed was taking so long which only made me self conscious and more uncomfortable they ended up using vacuum and had 3rd degree tear could feel them stitching me up for some reason be okay with having another one and would still do it naturally had 16 hours of labor with pitocin and all that jazz which finally culminated in an emergency section and that after horrific pregnancy deciding to have the second is tough with the first one you do know what coming but with the second you know exactly how bad it can be that being said we are trying for after we go to hersheypark this friday the states to honor both sets of parents where they do use the term back labor but it was hell on earth and would have killed myself if could have thank god could anyway like said it simple survival instinct to want to avoid that again and childbirth used to kill us regularly still does so on the sly in developed nations and still on the regular in unlucky ones but we usually come out nowadays
